newsitem.title: USA: Oregon regulators set Enron, Portland hearing date.
newsitem.headline: Oregon regulators set Enron, Portland hearing date.

text.p: Enron Corp said on Monday its proposal to acquire Portland General Corp would be presented directly to the Oregon Public Utility Commission in a public meeting on February 14.
This was the first date all three of the commissioners are available, Enron said.

Previously, the company had expected settlement of last week's conferences with the commission's staff to result in the issue of a final recommendation and proposed order on January 31, with the commission seen making a final decision on March 17.
The companies and the staff were unable to resolve their differences last week and the meetings ended without an agreement, Enron said.
It said unresolved issues included a staff proposal to require payments from Enron's existing and future non-regulated competitive businesses for Portland General Electric's customers.
The "staff's proposal requests cost savings that Enron and PGC believe far exceeds the level of cost savings that could be achieved by the merger", Enron said.

The staff's proposal would fund additional rate cuts for the power customers by taking revenues from Enron's non-regulated businesses without the customers assuming the costs and risks of such businesses, it added.

It noted both Enron and Portland General have asked that as a condition of the merger the commission require the segregation of the costs, risks and benefits of regulated and non-regulated activities.

"Our merger does not contemplate the employee layoffs or significant short-term cost cutting typical of mergers between neighbouring utilities or overlapping competitors," said Enron chief executive Kenneth L. Lay.
